references.paper_title: BRITS: bidirectional recurrent imputation for time series
references.reason: This paper introduces a key method (BRITS) for multivariate time series imputation, which is directly compared against in the current paper and is a major influence on its design.

references.paper_title: STL: A seasonal-trend decomposition procedure based on Loess
references.reason: This foundational paper details the STL decomposition method, which is a core component of the current paper's approach and heavily influences its analysis of residual imputation error.
This highly influential paper introduces the denoising diffusion probabilistic model (DDPM), which forms the basis for the frequency-aware diffusion model implemented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: CSDI: conditional score-based diffusion models for probabilistic time series imputation
references.reason: This paper introduces the method CSDI, which directly addresses multivariate time series imputation and is used as a core comparison point for evaluating the current paper's model.

references.paper_title: Multivariate time-series imputation with disentangled temporal representations
references.reason: This paper also directly tackles multivariate time series imputation and provides a relevant comparison for the new FGTI method.
